textfields.tf: Lower level: 21 counts; Driving level: 100 counts; Upper level: 116 counts
Lower level: 15 counts; Driving level: 91 counts; Upper level: 132 counts
Lower level: 31 counts; Driving level: 96 counts; Upper level: 253 counts
Mark the case where a calibration error is generated. After that click on
In the following the reference level tolerance amounts to 5 counts. Which case generates a calibration error?
count value of the upper level >
count value driving level + triple reference level tolerance + 3 counts
count value driving level - double reference level tolerance

In the first case the second rule is broken. The distance between driving and upper level is too small. Driving level 100 counts + 3 x 5 + 3 results in 118 counts. The upper level should amount to at least 119 counts.
No, this generates not a calibration error, because these count values comply with all three rules.
Right, the second rule is broken here. The distance between driving and upper level is too small.
